intro: Crotalaria vagans, commonly known as the wandering crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Crotalaria vagans is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. It is also recognized for its potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
